when_to_say: Used to refer to the star at the center of the solar system.
example: الشمس مشرقة اليوم. (al-shams mushriqa al-yawm.) - The sun is shining today.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the natural satellite of Earth.
example: القمر في السماء. (al-qamar fi al-sama') - The moon is in the sky.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the expanse above the Earth.
example: السماء صافية اليوم. (al-sama' ṣāfiya al-yawm.) - The sky is clear today.

when_to_say: Used to refer to water droplets falling from the sky.
example: كان هناك مطر غزير أمس. (kāna hunāka maṭar ghazīr ams.) - There was heavy rain yesterday.

when_to_say: Used to refer to frozen water crystals falling from the sky.
example: يحب الأطفال اللعب في الثلج. (yuḥibbu al-aṭfāl al-la'ba fi al-thalj.) - Children love playing in the snow.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the invisible gaseous substance that surrounds the Earth.
example: الهواء منعش اليوم. (al-hawā' muna'ish al-yawm.) - The air is refreshing today.

when_to_say: Used to refer to moving air.
example: الرياح قوية اليوم. (al-riyāḥ qawīya al-yawm.) - The winds are strong today.

when_to_say: Used to refer to visible masses of condensed water vapor in the sky.
example: السماء مليئة بالغيم. (al-sama' malī'a bi al-ghaym.) - The sky is full of clouds.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a violent disturbance of the atmosphere.
example: كانت هناك عاصفة قوية. (kānat hunāka ʿāṣifa qawīya.) - There was a strong storm.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the degree of warmth.
example: الحرارة مرتفعة اليوم. (al-ḥarāra murtafi'a al-yawm.) - The heat is high today.
